intro: Hebecarpa punctata, commonly known as the spotted hebecarpa, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges and are often covered in fine pubescence. Hebecarpa punctata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
